text: welcome to day two of the aws recap show
i'm jeff barr
i'm coming to you live from the expo
hall of aws re invent in las vegas my
co-host lee has been reporting from the
field
with 9 000 people in attendance re
invent is definitely the cool place to
be this week for those who are not able
to attend the keynote sessions are being
streamed live from the aws website
aws senior vice president andy jassy
opened the day with a rousing keynote
talk
andy reviewed the current state of aws
and then announced three new services
amazon cloudtrail captures aws api
activity and stores the log files in
amazon s3 for analysis
amazon workspaces supports desktop
computing in the cloud
these environments are accessible from
pcs kindles ipads and android tablets
amazon appstream delivers streaming
applications from the cloud it can be
used to build rich high fidelity
applications that start instantly and
run on simple devices
you can read my blog to learn more about
all three of these brand new services
re invent attendees have had their
choice of over 175 sessions spread over
13 tracks
ranging from the introductory to the
deeply technical
in fact over 50 percent of the sessions
are at the 300 and 400 level designed
for advanced and expert users
we added additional sessions today in
order to provide attendees with more
information about appstream cloudtrail
and workspaces
as you can see the expo hall has just
been a buzz of activity all day with
plenty of demos and discussions of the
latest and greatest in cloud tools and
applications from our sponsors
all three of the new aws services were
on display with staff on hand to answer
questions and to collect feedback
last night the winners of the aws
hackathon were recognized the winning
application solved problems faced by
donorschoose.org
today re invent attendees have the
opportunity to become aws certified
solution architects developers and
system administrators while on site
stay tuned for my coverage of day three
of aws reinvent from las vegas this is
jeff barr
